message.content:
cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with a problem in choice theory related to voting aggregation, which involves ranking candidates based on preferences. The paper proposes novel distance measures between permutations that arise in practical applications and considers algorithmic aspects associated with distance-based aggregation processes. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the sub-categories of computer science that deal with algorithms, data structures, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and information theory. Specifically, cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are the most likely sub-categories, as the paper deals with algorithmic aspects of the problem and proposes novel distance measures. cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) are also likely sub-categories, as the paper deals with voting aggregation and considers similarities between candidates. Finally, cs.IT (Information Theory) is a possible sub-category, as the paper considers axiomatic approaches to derive the distance measures.
